args:
The party learns Simurgh was rampaging in
search of her stolen egg, and decides to put
one egg hunt on hold for another. Using Fleur's
map, the prince and friends search for the
fiends' nest.
The prince's party rushes to\nquell the raging dragon...
SKREEEE! RETURN MY EGG TO ME!
Y-you mean like one'a these painted eggs?\nHere, take one'a—
FOOL! I seek MY egg—WHERE IS IT?!
There's Simurgh!\nWe've got to get the people out of here...
Where is it?! WHERE HAS IT GOOOONE?!\nSKREEEE!
I'll calm her down.\nEverybody, hold your breath!
What in the world was that contraption,\nLuca?

Heh heh, one'a my latest! It releases
smoke that makes people chill the heck
out. I've always got a couple on me,
just in case someone throws a tantrum.

But where did you procure the
ingredients to generate such
an effect? They're certainly
not local to these woods...
We can swap recipes later.\nYou feelin' a little better, Simurgh?
I... I am. Please, forgive the trouble\nI have caused. I was not myself.
We know. But what was it that set you off?
I was warming my egg, as is normal,\nand fell into a light slumber. \nWhen I awoke, the egg was gone.
While you were sleeping?! Not cool!\nDo you know who did it?
Is it possible someone from the hunt\nmistook it for a painted egg?
No way; dragon eggs radiate mana like\nnobody's business.
Indeed. Sylvans excel in the perception\nof mana; one would not simply abscond\nwith a dragon egg by accident.
Wait a sec—weren't those fiends from\nearlier scoopin' up painted eggs?
Ya think they coulda nabbed Simurgh's?
Hmmm... Or maybe they were after\nher egg from the start!

Which means they would have been
systematically collecting every egg
in the forest, blind as they are to
the nuances of mana.
Do you think they want to...eat it?

Hey, {player_name}—I think we
better put a hold on the
egg hunt. Or, you know,
hunt for this egg instead.
Yeah. We have to help Simurgh.
How are we gonna find the fiends that\ntook it though?
I was thinkin' we'd just, uh...beat up\nevery fiend in the forest till we found\nthe right one?
Nya ha ha! Now there's a plan!
...You can't be serious. We're working\nfrom naught but supposition, and have\nno handle on the number of fiends here.
I acknowledge your plight, Simurgh,\nbut I cannot act on conjecture alone.\nI have a competition to win, besides.
What gives, Sylas? You might'a been\na crybaby way back when, but at least\nyou had a heart. The hell happened?
YOU may let your emotions guide your\nactions, Luca, but I most certainly do not.\nI have my future to consider.
Ya really wanna win that bad? Just so\nyou can keep sylvans separate from\nthe rest of the world?
Call it what you will. My chance has\ncome at long last, and I shall not falter.
With the egg hunt won, my objective will\nfinally be within reach.
Hold up—what ＂objective＂?\nWhat exactly are you trying to do?
I intend to harness the medicinal qualities\nof certain herbs, to pioneer an aromatic\nthat can cure illness.
One pivotal herb evades me, however.\nTo gather it, I require permission from\nthe chief of the northeast wood.

To that end, I have done my best
to genuflect. On occasion that has
involved obeying...unsavory commands.
But obey them I have.
He has promised to consider my request,\nshould I win this egg hunt.
And with that victory, ratify his\ndesire to prevent any interaction\nbetween sylvans and outsiders...
Perhaps.\nBut my research will save lives.
You're seriously gonna ignore someone\nwho needs help, just so you can get\nwhat YOU want?
I don't expect you to comprehend the trials\nI have endured to even HAVE this chance.
For someone so smart, you sure make\na convincing idiot.
You're SOOOO sure you can't do your\nresearch anywhere but your own village—\nbut why? You're just scared, man.
You claim it could be done elsewhere?
YES, DUDE! I'd even help you!
But it's not; you still have a choice.\nCome with us, and you'll be free to—
Enough! I have come too far to\nbe swayed by your blathering.
Forget it, Luca. He's made up his mind.
We can get Simurgh's egg back on\nour own—but we gotta get going.
...Right. But Sylas? I still believe in you,\ndude. I know you'll do the right thing.
We do not all share your definition\nof ＂right.＂
You've known Luca for a long time;\nis he really the type to say something\nhe doesn't believe?
Truth does not hinge on belief.
You're right. But believing in something\nCAN make it possible.
Hmph. His beliefs don't outweigh\nmy own. And I believe I have no\nneed for the knowledge of humans.
What about the calmbomb Luca used\nearlier?
He made it by combining the techniques\nand advancements of both humans and\nsylvans.
Yes, and the human element was\nlikely superfluous.
I'm not so sure. It incorporated things\nyou can't find in the woods; seashells,\nalpine plants, human research.
If Luca could make something like\nthat by embracing the outside world, \nwhat do you think YOU could achieve?
I think that's why Luca is so desperate\nfor you to widen your perspective.
Luca believes in you, Sylas—and so do I.\nWe're going on ahead, but I hope you'll\nfollow when you're ready.
I've been so intent on pursuing wisdom...\nI fear I've only grown more ignorant.
Perhaps there truly is something\nto be gained by leaving the forest...
Whew... These fiends are really\nputting up a fight.
You think they know we're here\nfor the eggs?
Sure seems like it. They're givin' it\neverything they got!
Really, Luca. These fiends aren't\nanything special. Hah!
What was that, Sylas? It smells...sweet.

Just a basic aroma oil. I believe I
mentioned earlier that insects have
a keen sense of smell; let this serve
as further evidence.
GAAH! There's bees everywhere!\nWait... They're swarming the fiends!
Ha ha! They ran right off!\nNice one, Sylas.
Given time to think, I latched onto\none particularly curious aspect of\nthe fiends' behavior.
Rather than eat the eggs, they were\ncollecting them—not unlike ants.\nIf we consider that...
...Then there must be a fiend nest\nwhere they're keepin' all the eggs!
Yes, and Simurgh's egg is likely there\nas well. You there—you have a map of\nthe woods, yes?
If we use it to espy likely nesting areas,\nand check them off as we go, we should\neventually find the nest.
Heh. So you're gonna help us then?
...My grander plan hasn't changed.\nBut I also cannot stand idly by knowing\nsomething is amiss.
But more than that... I found myself\nwishing to hear more of the world\nyou have come to hold so dear, Luca.
So yes, you have my aid.\nNow let us end this swiftly.
